intro: Hieracium csereianum, commonly known as the Hungarian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers appear in the summer, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium csereianum is also known for its ability to colonize areas quickly, making it both a common weed and an indicator of nutrient-rich soil.
